content:
X509SecurityTokenParameters Class

In this Article

Represents the parameters for an X.509 security token.

Syntax

Declaration

public class X509SecurityTokenParameters : System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.SecurityTokenParameters

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.SecurityTokenParameters
  • X509SecurityTokenParameters

Inherited Members

,
Equals(Object,Object)
,

,
GetType()
,

,

,

,

,
MatchesKeyIdentifierClause(SecurityToken,SecurityKeyIdentifierClause,SecurityTokenReferenceStyle)
,
ReferenceStyle
,
RequireDerivedKeys

Remarks

This class is a collection of token properties and methods, and is used in creating security binding elements and tokens.

Constructors summary

X509SecurityTokenParameters()

Initializes a new instance of the X509SecurityTokenParameters class.
X509SecurityTokenParameters(X509KeyIdentifierClauseType)

Initializes a new instance of the X509SecurityTokenParameters class.
X509SecurityTokenParameters(X509SecurityTokenParameters)

Initializes a new instance of the X509SecurityTokenParameters class.
X509SecurityTokenParameters(X509KeyIdentifierClauseType,SecurityTokenInclusionMode)

Initializes a new instance of the X509SecurityTokenParameters class.

Properties summary

HasAsymmetricKey

Gets a value that indicates whether the token has an asymmetric key.
SupportsClientAuthentication

Gets a value that indicates whether the token supports client authentication.
SupportsClientWindowsIdentity

Gets a value that indicates whether the token supports a Windows identity for authentication.
SupportsServerAuthentication

Gets a value that indicates whether the token supports server authentication.
X509ReferenceStyle

Gets and sets the X.509 reference style.

Methods summary

CloneCore()

Clones another instance of this instance of the class.
CreateKeyIdentifierClause(SecurityToken,SecurityTokenReferenceStyle)

Creates a key identifier clause for a token.
InitializeSecurityTokenRequirement(SecurityTokenRequirement)

Initializes a security token requirement.
ToString()

Displays a text representation of this instance of the class.

Constructors

  • X509SecurityTokenParameters()

    Initializes a new instance of the X509SecurityTokenParameters class.

    public X509SecurityTokenParameters ();
  • X509SecurityTokenParameters(X509KeyIdentifierClauseType)

    Initializes a new instance of the X509SecurityTokenParameters class.

    public X509SecurityTokenParameters (System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.X509KeyIdentifierClauseType x509ReferenceStyle);

    Parameters

    • x509ReferenceStyle
      X509KeyIdentifierClauseType

      An X509KeyIdentifierClauseType.

    Remarks

    X509ReferenceStyle describes the kinds of security key identifier clauses that can be used to refer to the X509 security token. By default, references by Thumbprint, IssuerSerial, SubjectKeyIdentifier, and RawDataKeyIdentifier are accepted.

    The following new instance property values are set to their defaults:

    • InclusionMode is set to X509KeyIdentifierClauseType.

    • ReferenceStyle is set to SecurityTokenReferenceStyle.

    • RequireDerivedKeys is set to true.

      The corresponding properties are set to the values in the input parameters.

  • X509SecurityTokenParameters(X509SecurityTokenParameters)

    Initializes a new instance of the X509SecurityTokenParameters class.

    protected X509SecurityTokenParameters (System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.X509SecurityTokenParameters other);

    Parameters

    • other
      X509SecurityTokenParameters

      The other instance of this class.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      other is null.

    Remarks

    The new instance property values are set to the corresponding values in other.

  • X509SecurityTokenParameters(X509KeyIdentifierClauseType,SecurityTokenInclusionMode)

    Initializes a new instance of the X509SecurityTokenParameters class.

    public X509SecurityTokenParameters (System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.X509KeyIdentifierClauseType x509ReferenceStyle, System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.SecurityTokenInclusionMode inclusionMode);

    Parameters

    • x509ReferenceStyle
      X509KeyIdentifierClauseType

      An X509KeyIdentifierClauseType.

    • inclusionMode
      SecurityTokenInclusionMode

      A SecurityTokenInclusionMode.

    Remarks

    The following new instance property values are set to their defaults:

    • InclusionMode is set to inclusionMode.

    • ReferenceStyle is set to x509ReferenceStyle.

    • RequireDerivedKeys is set to true.

      The corresponding properties are set to the values in the input parameters.

Properties

  • HasAsymmetricKey

    Gets a value that indicates whether the token has an asymmetric key.

    protected override bool HasAsymmetricKey { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      True if the token has an asymmetric key; otherwise, false. Always returns false.

    Remarks

    Asymmetric keys are used in public-key cryptography, which uses two keys, a public key and a private key, which are related mathematically. The public key is distributed widely, but the private key is kept secret. In public-key cryptography, there is no need to exchange a common key.

  • SupportsClientAuthentication

    Gets a value that indicates whether the token supports client authentication.

    protected override bool SupportsClientAuthentication { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      True if the token supports client authentication; otherwise, false. Always returns true.

  • SupportsClientWindowsIdentity

    Gets a value that indicates whether the token supports a Windows identity for authentication.

    protected override bool SupportsClientWindowsIdentity { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      True if the token supports a Windows identity for authentication; otherwise, false. Always returns true.

  • SupportsServerAuthentication

    Gets a value that indicates whether the token supports server authentication.

    protected override bool SupportsServerAuthentication { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      True if the token supports server authentication; otherwise, false. Always returns true.

  • X509ReferenceStyle

    Gets and sets the X.509 reference style.

    public System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.X509KeyIdentifierClauseType X509ReferenceStyle { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • X509KeyIdentifierClauseType

      An X509KeyIdentifierClauseType.

    Example

    The following code shows how to set this property. 

                AsymmetricSecurityBindingElement abe =
                (AsymmetricSecurityBindingElement)SecurityBindingElement.
                CreateMutualCertificateBindingElement(
                MessageSecurityVersion.
                WSSecurity10WSTrustFebruary2005WSSecureConversationFebruary2005WSSecurityPolicy11BasicSecurityProfile10);

            abe.SetKeyDerivation(false);
            
            X509SecurityTokenParameters istp =
               abe.InitiatorTokenParameters as X509SecurityTokenParameters;
            if (istp != null)
            {
                istp.X509ReferenceStyle =
                X509KeyIdentifierClauseType.IssuerSerial;
            }

    			Dim abe As AsymmetricSecurityBindingElement = CType(SecurityBindingElement.CreateMutualCertificateBindingElement(MessageSecurityVersion.WSSecurity10WSTrustFebruary2005WSSecureConversationFebruary2005WSSecurityPolicy11BasicSecurityProfile10), AsymmetricSecurityBindingElement)

			abe.SetKeyDerivation(False)

			Dim istp As X509SecurityTokenParameters = TryCast(abe.InitiatorTokenParameters, X509SecurityTokenParameters)
			If istp IsNot Nothing Then
				istp.X509ReferenceStyle = X509KeyIdentifierClauseType.IssuerSerial
			End If

Methods

  • CloneCore()

    Clones another instance of this instance of the class.

    protected override System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.SecurityTokenParameters CloneCore ();

    Returns

    • System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.SecurityTokenParameters

      A new instance of the SecurityTokenParameters.

    Remarks

    The Clone and CloneCore methods follow the Core design pattern.

    CloneCore is an abstract class which is overridden by CloneCore.

    The CloneCore method calls the X509SecurityTokenParameters constructor.

  • CreateKeyIdentifierClause(SecurityToken,SecurityTokenReferenceStyle)

    Creates a key identifier clause for a token.

    protected override System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause CreateKeyIdentifierClause (System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken token, System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.SecurityTokenReferenceStyle referenceStyle);

    Parameters

    • token
      SecurityToken

      The token.

    • referenceStyle
      SecurityTokenReferenceStyle

      The SecurityTokenReferenceStyle.

    Returns

    • SecurityKeyIdentifierClause

      The security key identifier clause.

  • InitializeSecurityTokenRequirement(SecurityTokenRequirement)

    Initializes a security token requirement.

    protected override void InitializeSecurityTokenRequirement (System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenRequirement requirement);

    Parameters

    • requirement
      SecurityTokenRequirement

      The SecurityTokenRequirement.

    Remarks

    The following properties of the SecurityTokenRequirement are initialized:

    • TokenType = X509Certificate.

    • RequireCryptographicToken = true.

      KeyType = SecurityKeyType.

  • ToString()

    Displays a text representation of this instance of the class.

    public override string ToString ();

    Returns

    • String

      A text representation of this instance of this class.
